text:
FYI: Version 5.1.0 of `@HubSpot/cli` has introduced an error that will affect all automated deployments, which use the `--use-env`  flag.
It still actively looks for a `HubSpot.config.yml`, which doesn’t exist in this environment.

Added an issue regarding it. You can fix it by setting `5.0.2` as the version in the deployment.

<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cli/issues/970>

I seem to notice it being slower on the system domains but that might be incidental, as also running the pagespeed insights also seems to vary the server speed

The other thing to check is that your pages can be prerendered, you can actually do this by using the ?hsDebug=true parameter and checking the source code (you’ll see at the bottom of the code it tells you if the page can be pre-rendered and will also tell you how long it takes for each included template/module/partial/macro to run

you can read more about prerendering here
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/cdn/prerendering>
